workshop_main_page_main_text_1: Traderlands gives you all the tools you need to automate your trading experience. You can design a strategy by creating buy and sell rule sets, or you can turn your Tradingview strategies into a trading robot via Traderlands. You can publish your successful strategies on the Traderlands Marketplace!
workshop_main_page_option_1_text: You can design your dream strategy by combining dozens of technical analysis indicators in the Traderlands Strategy Designer with fundamental analysis metrics.
workshop_main_page_option_2_text: You can easily turn the strategies you have developed on Tradingview into automated trading robots by importing them to Traderlands.
workshop_main_page_info_text_1: You can become a Strategy Creator for publishing the strategies on the Marketplace. Get detailed information about creating a strategy at Traderlands through Tutorials or our Blog.
workshop_main_page_info_text_2: As a Strategy Creator at Traderlands, you can publish your backtested successful strategies on the Marketplace. Apply to become a Creator!
workshop_main_page_info_text_3: Your application to become a Strategy Creator is still under evaluation.
workshop_main_page_info_text_4: The evaluation result of your application to be a Creator is currently negative. You can apply again after editing the information you entered previously in the application form.
workshop_main_page_info_text_5: By visiting your Creator Panel, you can edit your Creator profile, publish new strategies on the Marketplace or make changes to your published strategies.
workshop_presets_main_text: You can specify the name of the strategy you want to develop, the exchange and pairs you want it to work with via this screen.
workshop_presets_choose_parities_text_1: Select the parities you want to run your strategy.
workshop_presets_choose_parities_text_2: Please select an exchange before selecting pairs.
workshop_tl_strategy_page_main_text: Define the entry and exit algorithms, static trading settings and time-based options you want to run in your strategy.
workshop_tl_strategy_page_rule_group_cla: Which clause do you want to use to connect the rules?
workshop_tl_strategy_page_indicator_para: The default value is {{default}}. The maximum value is {{max}}, the minimum value is {{min}}.
workshop_tl_strategy_page_trade_settings: Minimum Wait Time For New Trade (Min.)
workshop_backtest_settings_main_text: You can create a new backtest or view your previous backtest results
workshop_backtest_empty_error: You need to choose a date and parity options to create a backtest
workshop_backtest_previous_results_no_ba: There are no backtests for this strategy.
workshop_backtest_result_page_main_text: You can view the backtest results of the pair that you run your strategy
workshop_robot_status_main_text: In order to open positions with the strategy you have designed, you need to determine the robot status. You can choose Real Trades to trade on your Exchange account or Live Test to test your strategy with realtime data.
workshop_robot_working_status_option_1_t: Fully operational; open new and track existing positions
workshop_robot_working_status_option_2_t: Semi-operational; track existing but don’t open new positions
workshop_budget_settings_main_text: You can set up the budget settings for your robot using this strategy.
workshop_budget_settings_division_budget: Budget amount should be larger than 0.

tooltip.Enter Algorithm info: The rules in the enter algorithm are connected each other with AND condition. The conditions in all rule groups must be met for the input algorithm to work.
tooltip.Workshop/Strategy Design/Rule connection: When Rules in a Rule Group are linked together with the conjunction AND, the conditions in all designed rules must be met. When it is connected with the OR connector, it is sufficient to fulfill the condition in only one of the designed rules.
tooltip.Workshop/Strategy Design/Operators: Operators define the condition between the right side and the lefts side in a rule. You can choose an Indicator or a Value and create a condition by the operators as: = Equal != Not Equal > Bigger Than >= Bigger Than or Equal < Smaller Than <= Smaller Than or Equal You choose a range between left side and the right side as: Between Not Between Between or Equal Between or Not Equal
tooltip.Exit Algorithm info: When the Rule groups in the Exit Algorithm are connected to each other with AND condition, then all the rule sets conditions must be met for the exit algorithm to work When rule groups are connected to each other with OR condition, it is sufficient to fulfill one of the conditions inthe designed rule groups.
tooltip.Trade Settings Info:
Stop Loss: If you fill this field empty or choose 0(Zero) as the value, the Stop Loss will be disabled. Stop Loss lets you to define static selling points in decided loss percent. Enter values between 1-100(%) 
 Take Profit:   Stop Loss lets you to define static selling points in decided profit percent. Enter values between 1-100(%) 
 Trailing Stop: You can set up a trailing stop point in order to make your stop loss to follow up your profit. Herewith, when your position reached to your decided trailing stop point, your minimum profit will be covered by the distance value. Enter values between 1-100(%) and enter distance value smaller then trailing stop percent.
tooltip.trade_settings_info_stop_loss: If you fill this field empty or choose 0(Zero) as the value, the Stop Loss will be disabled. Stop Loss lets you to define static selling points in decided loss percent. Enter values between 0-100(%)
tooltip.trade_settings_info_take_profit: Lets you to define static selling target point in decided profit percent. Enter values between 0-100(%)
tooltip.trade_settings_info_trailing_stop: You can set up a trailing stop point in order to make your stop loss to follow up your profit. Herewith, when your position reached to your decided trailing stop point, your minimum profit will be covered by the distance value. Enter values between 0-100(%)
tooltip.trade_settings_info_following_distance: Defines the distance between your trailing stop activation point and your stop loss point will be carried on. Enter values between 0-100(%)
tooltip.trade_settings_info_minimum_stand_open: Don't use exit strategy if trade duration lower than this value (in Minutes)
tooltip.trade_settings_info_maximum_stand_open: Sell immediately if trade duration exceeds this value (in Minutes)
tooltip.trade_settings_info_minimum_wait_time: Don't trade in same pair after the previous position duration, (in Minutes)

error.This field should not be empty: This field should not be empty
error.Execution type should not be empty: Market type should not be empty.
error.This field's value is not between minimu: This field's value is not between minimum and maximum value.
error.Enter algorithm should not be empty: Enter algorithm should not be empty
error.Exit algorithm or trade settings should: Exit algorithm or trade settings should not be empty.
error.Please fill budget settings for at least: Please fill budget settings for at least one base parity or make the strategy virtual.
error.Please enter a positive value for the am: Please enter a positive value for the amount field.
error.You can not change exchange or execution: You can not change exchange or execution types for a strategy published on the Marketplace.
error.You can not change the exchange or execu: You can not change the exchange or execution type fields for a strategy with open positions.
error.If trailing stop is enabled, follow dist: In order to use trailing stop you need to define distance value
error.If follow distance has been set but trai: You can't use follow distance feature without setting trailing stop value
